etymology.description: 艹(艹) (cǎo, "grass") + phonetic: 亥(亥) (hài, a branch of the Earthly Branches) = plant-related term with phonetic hint
etymology.interpretation: The 艹(艹) (cǎo, "grass") component signifies a connection to plants or vegetation, while 亥(亥) (hài) provides the phonetic guide. This combination expresses the concept of roots.

examples.chinese: 老农在春雨后挖掘荄(老農在春雨後挖掘荄)，期待着新一季的丰收(期待著新一季的豐收)。
examples.pinyin: lǎo nóng zài chūn yǔ hòu wā jué hài, qí dài zhe xīn yī jì de fēng shōu.
examples.english: The old farmer dug out the roots after the spring rain, anticipating a bountiful harvest for the new season.

examples.chinese: 湿土中偶露荄(濕土中偶露荄)，暗示着土壤深处的秘密(暗示著土壤深處的秘密)。
examples.pinyin: shī tǔ zhōng ǒu lù hài, àn shì zhe tǔ rǎng shēn chù de mì mì.
examples.english: Amid the damp soil, the roots occasionally appeared, hinting at the secrets deep within the earth.
